markdown:
Sky dragons live above the clouds near the summits of mountains. They maintain a strong religious tradition, a unique practice among imperial dragons that sets them apart as much as their wings do. Desperate souls risk steep cliffs and loose snow to seek these dragons' counsel, and most sky dragons gladly help those who make the journey, but they expel any express hostilities or badger without hesitation. The sky dragon's wings aren't true wings, but long fins fused to their forearms; their scales also form only very slowly. Young dragons coil tightly in their lairs as they absorb minerals that color and harden their scales. Even adults often wrap around pillars out of habit. **[Recall Knowledge - Dragon](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2)): DC 43 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 41 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 38 [Ancient Sky Dragon](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1130) **Source** [Bestiary 3](/Sources.aspx?ID=66) pg. 80 **Perception** +32; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=33) (imprecise) 60 feet **Languages** [Auran](/Languages.aspx?ID=15), [Celestial](/Languages.aspx?ID=16), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2), [Elven](/Languages.aspx?ID=4), [Infernal](/Languages.aspx?ID=19), [Sylvan](/Languages.aspx?ID=10) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +28, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +35, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +28, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +32, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +34, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +26, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +28, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +28 **Str** +8 **Dex** +4 **Con** +5 **Int** +4 **Wis** +6 **Cha** +6 **Mist Vision** Fog and mist don't impair a sky dragon's vision; they ignore the [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4) condition from fog and mist. --- **AC** 42 **Fort** +31 **Ref** +28 **Will** +32 +1 status to all saves vs. magic **HP** 335 **Immunities** electricity, [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [sleep](/Traits.aspx?ID=145) **Countered by Fire** If the sky dragon takes fire damage, the elemental magic of metal within them is tempered. Until the end of their next turn, they take a –1 circumstance penalty to attack rolls and AC, and their jaws Strikes don't deal electricity damage. This limitation ends if the dragon uses Breath Weapon.
**Fed by Earth** ([abjuration](/Traits.aspx?ID=2), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48)) When a sky dragon is targeted by an [earth](/Traits.aspx?ID=55) spell or effect, they leave a cloud of pulverized dust and gravel that swirls in the eddies of the dragon's flight. For 1 minute, the dragon is [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4) while flying.
**[Frightful Presence](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=17)** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) 90 feet, DC 38 --- **Speed** 60 feet, fly 160 feet **Melee** jaws +36 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d10+16 piercing plus 1d12 electricity **Melee** claw +36 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d10+16 slashing plus [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18) **Melee** tail +36 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d10+16 bludgeoning plus [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18) **Divine Innate Spells** DC 42 - **1st** [Feather Fall](/Spells.aspx?ID=111), [Gust of Wind](/Spells.aspx?ID=143) - **4th** [Gaseous Form](/Spells.aspx?ID=129), [Invisibility](/Spells.aspx?ID=164) **Breath Weapon** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Electricity](/Traits.aspx?ID=56), [Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65)) The dragon shoots a ball of electricity that deals 9d12 electricity damage and 2d12 sonic damage in a 30-foot burst within 60 feet (DC 40 basic Reflex save). They can't use Breath Weapon again for 1d4 rounds. See divine lightning below. **Coiling Frenzy** The dragon makes one claw Strike and one tail Strike in either order, each against the same target. If either Strike hits, the dragon automatically [Grabs](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18) the target. **Divine Lightning** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48)) A good sky dragon who worships a deity channels divine power through its attacks, making them more effective against [fiends](/Traits.aspx?ID=70) and [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160). Any electricity damage it deals becomes good damage against fiends or positive damage against undead. **Draconic Momentum** The dragon recharges their Breath Weapon whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike. **[Greater Constrict](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=19)** 3d10+11 bludgeoning, DC 40 **Perfected Flight** A sky dragon can hover in place without spending an action, and they automatically succeed at all [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) checks to [Maneuver in Flight](/Actions.aspx?ID=30). **Stunning Electricity** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Electricity](/Traits.aspx?ID=56), [Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93)) The dragon rapidly coils, then unleashes crackling lightning that deals 5d12 electricity damage in a 60-foot emanation. Each creature in the area must attempt a DC 40 Fortitude save; regardless of the outcome, the creature then becomes temporarily immune for 10 minutes.
**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** Half damage, and the creature is [stunned 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=36).
**Failure** Full damage, and the creature is stunned for 1 round and can't fly for 4 rounds.
**Critical Failure** Double damage, and the creature is stunned for 2 rounds and can't fly for 1 minute.
name: Ancient Sky Dragon

They maintain a strong religious tradition, a unique practice among imperial dragons that sets them apart as much as their wings do. Desperate souls risk steep cliffs and loose snow to seek these dragons' counsel, and most sky dragons gladly help those who make the journey, but they expel any express hostilities or badger without hesitation. The sky dragon's wings aren't true wings, but long fins fused to their forearms; their scales also form only very slowly. Young dragons coil tightly in their lairs as they absorb minerals that color and harden their scales. Even adults often wrap around pillars out of habit. This limitation ends if the dragon uses Breath Weapon. For 1 minute, the dragon is concealed while flying. Divine Lightning (Divine) A good sky dragon who worships a deity channels divine power through its attacks, making them more effective against fiends and undead. Any electricity damage it deals becomes good damage against fiends or positive damage against undead. Stunning Electricity Two Actions (Divine, Electricity, Evocation, Incapacitation) The dragon rapidly coils, then unleashes crackling lightning that deals 5d12 electricity damage in a 60-foot emanation. Each creature in the area must attempt a DC 40 Fortitude save; regardless of the outcome, the creature then becomes temporarily immune for 10 minutes. Critical Success The creature is unaffected. Critical Failure Double damage, and the creature is stunned for 2 rounds and can't fly for 1 minute.
